intro: Platanthera hyperborea var. major, commonly known as the greater marsh helleborine, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to northern regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its tall, slender stems that bear lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces greenish-yellow flowers in late summer, which are often clustered in racemes. It thrives in moist, calcareous soils and is typically found in wet meadows, bogs, and marshy areas. Due to its specialized habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and protected species in many regions.
